page.title: 14The Families in our School(2
page.content: In 1985 a lot of mothers work during the day. We did a survey in our school to find out how many mothers did work. We worked it out that 78% of mothers did work.Some of this work is part time. Some people find this a cause for social concern, others think it makes children more adaptable and is good for them. In 1985 the average number of children in a family is 2.6 but the number of children in a family does vary from one child to five. When we did the survey we also found out the position of the child in the family. There are 24 eldest children and there are 18 youngest children in our school. The average age of the parents is 33.
